I would grade this answer as a 50. 

While the answer provides some practical suggestions for emphasizing 'One God' in cultures that respect multiple deities, it lacks a clear emphasis on the uniqueness and exclusivity of the Christian God. It is important to uphold the doctrinal truth that there is only one true God and all other gods are false. The answer also leans heavily on cultural sensitivity and comparative religion, which could potentially dilute the message of the Bible. A Christian-specific worldview would require a stronger emphasis on the absolute truth of monotheism as revealed in the Bible.
